meanings.definition: Representing the most typical example of a particular type
meanings.sent1: The superhero in the comic was archetypical, with a cape and superpowers.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were archetypical of the civilization that once thrived there.
meanings.sent3: The archetypical detective solved the case by following the clues in reverse order.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was archetypical, shining brightly in a world full of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The archetypical image of a cowboy riding into the sunset stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an archetype
meanings.sent1: The symbols in the dream had an archetypical meaning that he couldn't ignore.
meanings.sent2: The ancient myths often contain archetypical characters like heroes and villains.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the archetypical hero had to face his fears to save the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were archetypical of someone who had studied the ancient texts.
meanings.sent5: The archetypical symbols appeared throughout the artwork, hinting at a deeper connection.

meanings.definition: Serving as a prototype or model
meanings.sent1: The new car design was archetypical, setting the standard for future models.
meanings.sent2: The archetypical house in the neighborhood was a two-story colonial with white pillars.
meanings.sent3: His archetypical invention revolutionized the way people communicated.
meanings.sent4: The archetypical dress design became a trendsetter in the fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: The archetypical blueprint guided the construction of the entire building.
